backend/main.mo: Actor managing sessions with scoreboard, events, team icons, and lifecycle controls including start, set icons, add events, and end session.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping microphone-related feature requirements to implementation files and components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text listing concise summaries for all frontend files including hooks, pages, layout, components, and camera logic.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base and theme variables defining light/dark color tokens and applying global background and border styles.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML entry point mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Sets up TanStack Router with root layout and routes for landing, broadcast, join, and watch pages.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Broadc: Mic toggle button component showing mic on/off state, loading, retry mode, and disabled handling.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Footba: Control panel enabling broadcasters to submit flag events with team selection and reason entry, with blocking before team icons are set.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Microp: UI component showing microphone-specific permission or device errors with retry support.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Permis: UI component displaying camera permission or device errors with retry functionality.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Scoreb: Provides UI to adjust team scores and roles and submit updates via a mutation.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Sessio: Displays the session code with a button to copy it to the clipboard.
frontend/src/components/events/EventFeed: Renders a scrollable list of game events with timestamps and icons.
frontend/src/components/events/FlagAnnou: Shows a styled overlay announcing a flag event for a specific team.
frontend/src/components/events/LatestEve: Displays a temporary overlay highlighting the most recent event.
frontend/src/components/layout/FootballL: Defines the main app layout with header, footer, and social links.
frontend/src/components/scoreboard/OnCam: Renders an on‑screen scoreboard overlay with team icons, scores, and offense indicator arrows.
frontend/src/components/scoreboard/Score: Wraps scoreboard-related content in a styled card with a title and optional icon.
frontend/src/components/system/Unsupport: Shows an error card indicating the browser lacks required features for broadcasting.
frontend/src/components/viewer/ViewerSub: Displays subtitles or a not‑supported message depending on browser capability and settings.
frontend/src/components/viewer/ViewerVid: Shows a video player shell with lifecycle-dependent status messages and optional child content.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to identity changes and invalidates dependent queries.
frontend/src/hooks/useBroadcasterSession: Manages broadcaster session state, generating session codes and calling mutations to start or end sessions. Tracks live status and team icon setup.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides context and hooks for managing Internet Identity auth flow, including loading stored identities and handling login states. Wraps AuthClient configuration and exposes login/clear functions.
frontend/src/hooks/useMicrophone.ts: Controls microphone access with start/stop logic, browser support checks, and detailed error handling. Returns stream and track references along with state flags.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for session validation, starting/ending sessions, event mutations, and fetching events or metadata. Uses an actor to interact with backend canister methods.
frontend/src/hooks/useSessionCode.ts: Stores and retrieves the current session code in localStorage. Provides setters and clear functionality.
frontend/src/hooks/useSessionLifecycle.t: Derives session lifecycle state based on metadata and loading status. Distinguishes waiting, live, ended, or unknown states.
Implements speech recognition hook handling start/stop, transcript updates, and error states. Uses browser SpeechRecognition APIs with continuous interim results.
frontend/src/hooks/useTimedFlagOverlay.t: Shows temporary overlays for new flag events, tracking seen flags in memory and sessionStorage. Automatically dismisses overlays after a set duration.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base/styles plus custom OKLCH color variables, dark mode overrides, and utility classes for scoreboard text and broadcast glow.
frontend/src/lib/teamIcons.ts: Defines team icon metadata, lookup helpers, and mappings from icons to scoreboard-friendly names.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Initializes React app with React Query and Internet Identity provider, then renders the root component.
frontend/src/pages/BroadcasterPage.tsx: UI and logic for broadcasters to start a session, manage camera/mic, view events, and control live overlays and scoreboard.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Landing screen offering navigation to broadcasting or watching a game.
frontend/src/pages/ViewerJoinPage.tsx: Page for viewers to enter and validate a 6‑character session code before joining a stream.
frontend/src/pages/ViewerWatchPage.tsx: Viewer watch interface showing video, event overlays, scoreboard, subtitles, and session lifecycle handling.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind config enabling dark mode, custom OKLCH color tokens, extended theme utilities, and plugins.
project_state.json: Defines the project’s current streaming app state, including broadcaster-only session rules, scoreboard and flag overlay behavior, known issues, and a list of implemented features. Serves as a specification snapshot for fixing and extending the football-themed live streaming system.
